page.title: 14Traffic Congestion Llanrwst
page.content: This is a constant problem in Llanrwst, lying as it does on the road from the new coastal expressway to the A5 through Betws y Coed. At present all traffic must pass through the town which has a narrow main street further hampered by a dog-leg bend. Large lorries constantly use this road and those with wide and very long loads need an escort of motor police. Plans have been put forward to bypass the town, the more likely of which will have serious impact on the cattle market and the local senior school. The Bont Fawr (Big Bridge), built in the 17th century was designed for a horse and carriage. It is a hump -backed bridge, and on-coming cars cannot be seen from either direction. A traffic control system operated until recently but failed to provide a suitable answer.
